channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024080002
item.description:
Report E-2024080002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured during loading and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized neutralizer, granular absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024072349
item.description:
Report X-2024072349

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic crate containing a self inflation raft was dropped during the sorting process. The gas cylinder attached to the raft discharge causing the raft to inflate destroying the plastic crate. The raft was deflated and all contents of the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package.

item.title: Report X-2024071974
item.description:
Report X-2024071974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/21/2024 at approximately 1733, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a printing ink spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4-1 gallon plastic jugs. The shipment under the tracking number ending in -9348, was reportedly mishandled, resulting in spillage. The ink from the spill soaked into the labels, destroying all of the pertinent package information. The damaged pacakge was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held for the FAA.

item.description:
Report X-2024071994

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared spill incident. One 1-gallon metal can of Rust-Oleum ROCAlkyd 7400 enamel (Flashpoint 95 F) leaked due to the unclipped cap opening. One gallon spilled. Can is lightly dented. Insufficient dunnage. Carton shows no significant damage other than from internal leakage. No hazmat markings.

item.title: Report X-2024072203
item.description:
Report X-2024072203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operation at the MEMH location a wooden skid with two steel drums fell off the catwalk and was caught under a dolly. The skid was dragged an runover spilling the contents. The spill was cleaned up and everything was placed into a steel salvage package to be sent out for disposal and hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024072251
item.description:
Report X-2024072251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A SIMILAR GROUND PACKAGE CAME THROUGH AT THE SAME TIME AND WAS FOUND WITH UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THIS AIR PACKAGE, WE FOUND 20 X 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE QUICK CURE MULTI-PURPOSE FOAM SEALANT INSIDE THE BOX. THERE IS A POUCH AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX WITH A PACKING SLIP THAT INDICATES LTD QTY HAZMAT, CLASS 2.2, UN1956. THOSE INDICATORS WERE NOT VISIBLE AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
